intro: Quercus aliena var. jeholensis, commonly known as the Jehol oak, is a deciduous tree native to northern China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its lobed leaves and acorn-producing capsules. The plant typically grows in temperate forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its wood is hard and durable, making it valuable for construction and furniture. The species is also of interest to botanists due to its fossil record and evolutionary significance.
